fields.description: if you add an attachment to an issue, it is possible to make an comment at this point. But unfourtuanally, this comment did not belong to the attachment (only in activity this connection is viewable), i think it could be helpful to link the comment to the attachment and the attachment to the ("his") comment
fields.summary: Attachments and comments should belong together

However, the service is looking for new messages in *[jira.home]/import/mail*:

2011-06-01 14:50:37,667 QuartzWorker-1 DEBUG ServiceRunner     [atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner] Running Service [Container: com.atlassian.jira.service.services.file.FileService  delay [60000ms]]
2011-06-01 14:50:37,667 QuartzWorker-1 DEBUG ServiceRunner    fileservice [service.services.file.FileService] Getting files in directory: /home/bdziedzic/Desktop/atlassian-jira-4.3.3-standalone/jirahome/import/mail

fields.description: I was doing an import while some email was being sent and I got the attached [^deadlock.txt]. If e-mail is going to cause deadlocks then we should clear to queue and wait for any currently running items or kill -9 them before we start the import. We then need to make sure that no mail items are added to to queue while the import is progressing.
fields.summary: Can get deadlock when doing a restore and there are e-mails being sent.

fields.description:
I'm trying to translate my custom statuses to verify some Streams functionality. I'm at: http://localhost:3990/streams/secure/admin/ViewTranslations!default.jspa

However, if I change the name and description for one or more statuses and click "Update", the status name/descriptions are forgotten and the name is set back to the default english name. The description is cleared out entirely.
fields.summary: Cannot update translated status

fields.description:
I was restoring from xml backup and at the start, before the progress bar started to be calculated, it said "Progress unknown elapsed". We don't need the word "elapsed" as it doesn't make grammatical sense.

Reproduced with 4.4.m5
fields.summary: "Progress unknown elapsed" displayed sometimes during xml restore

fields.description:
Security auditing tests performed on a *Jira Bug Issue and Project Tracking Software* locally running instance shown that the application is succeptible to Horizontal Privilege Elevation attacks.

(!) *Case 1*:

Case 1, enables enables for an attacker to view the key ID from issues within a project to whom he has not been assigned to by fuzzing the subsequent URL:

[jira domain]/jira/rest/api/1.0/issues/32418/ActionsAndOperations?atl_token=A816-FTT5-H1WF-I743|e7960e65d3997cd8aebe3cabd0bfa3f71148069f|lin&_=1306849784317

To ilustrate in a more detailed manner, the first image outlined below describes the only project to whom the user is assigned to --- because of privacy concerns the name of our clients will appear blurred.

!projetoLiberadoParaUsuario.png!

However, the issue page contains a gear-like image (shown below) which spawns the aforementioned URL when clicked. As can be seen in the next image:

!urlSpawn.png!

By clicking this gear-like image, the subsequent request is generated:

!requestSpawned.png!

By using a fuzzing tool, the number *32418* --- generated by the request --- can be iterated to reveal other issue key ID's, including ones outside the project this user has been assigned to. As can be seen below:

!escalacaoHorizontalFuzz.png!

*Disclaimer*: The *key ID* value in our JIRA instance, represents *clients*/*company names* and cannot, in any way, leak. On the other hand, the issue key ID can be used to jumpstart other attacks. We would like to strongly state that, independently of our method of usage, we consider this an inadequate and dangerous behavior since, it enables for JIRA users to access information regarding other clients/projects, aside the ones that have been assigned to the user in question.

(!) *Case 2*:

*Case 2* provides for an even more dangerous scenario because this vulnerability can be exploited without the necessity for authentication.

Throughout the tests performed within JIRA, the subsequent URL was noticed:

[jira domain]/jira/secure/AttachScreenshot!default.jspa?id=37772

After requesting the aforementioned URL, a response is delivered, and part of the code within this response is presented below:

{noformat}
var parameters = {
scriptable:"false",post:"AttachScreenshot.jspa?secureToken=",
issue:39981,
screenshotname:"screenshot-1",
after:"/jira/browse/[CLIENT]-2150",
encoding:"UTF-8",
useragent: jQuery("#user-agent").text(),
{noformat}

The "*after:*" line contains an issue key ID, which reveals the name of a client (issue key ID's are named after client names within our JIRA instance). By extracting that line using a fuzzing tool, this attack provided the possibility for harvesting many more issues, which in case, revealed the name of many more clients.

The following image presents this behavior:

!fuzzIdResponse.png!

It is important to mention that, this user has only access to the first client appearing throughout the harvest. And as a result of this attack, many more clients were harvested.

*Disclaimer*: the *key ID* value in our JIRA instance, represents *clients*/*company names* and cannot, in any way, leak. On the other hand, the issue key ID can be used to jumpstart other attacks. We would like to strongly state that, independently of our method of usage, we consider this an inadequate and dangerous behavior since, it enables for JIRA users to access information regarding other clients/projects, aside the ones that have been assigned to the user in question.
fields.summary: Project key value can be discovered by users who have no access to the project data

fields.description:
Hello Guys,

Is there a way, or is there a plan to implement a way, to disable the modal screens in transitions, added in the last few versions of JIRA? 

In the old days, when clicking on the transition screens, the page would change into a new page, rather than blackening out and opening a new small window-box-like page with the contents of the screen. Ideally, there should be a way somewhere to enable switching those types of screens.

Any thoughts would be awesome.

Best Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Disable modal transition screens

fields.description:
What happen is the following:

- by using the Default Field Configuration the Priority field show up on the screen by default
- when you create a new issue, even then the Priority field is not mandatory, you need to pick up a value or the default will be set (there is no possibility to set a null value)
- if you Hide the Priority field, you are able to create an issue with a null Priority value and then the REST link (http://localhos:8080/rest/api/2.0.alpha1/issue/AAA-1) will work
- but if you Show the Priority field after the issue is already created, the value for Priority in the db will be null and you will not be able to access the issue trough the REST link. It will show the following:

{code}
This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below.
<status>
<status-code>404</status-code>
</status>
{code}
fields.summary: Issues not accessible via REST if Priority field is null

fields.description:
When issue comment contains '&' sign RSS XML response is not properly encoded.
Any client application that tries to read that not well formed XML response explodes.

I attached XML response from Customer. The RSS urls is like this  
http://HHHHHHHHHHH/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/IIIIIIII/SearchRequest-IIIIIIII.xml?sorter/field=&sorter/order=&pager/start=0&tempMax=25
WHERE:
HHHHHHHHHHH - replace with your JIRA host ie. your.jira.address.com:8080
IIIIIIII - replace with saved filter id this is an integer value ie. 100000.

related issue https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PL-2477
fields.summary: & sign is not properly encoded in RSS  XML

fields.description:
Normally, it is not possible to create duplicate users in JIRA. However, if using the SOAP Client-API then it is possible to create these duplicate users.

When this happens, then both the User Browser and Issue Navigator is inaccessible (even some functions that uses the User Browser i.e. multi user picket custom field).

A similar stack trace as the following will appear when browsing the above features:
{code}
2011-05-30 20:01:25,206 http-8330-Processor19 ERROR mche 72085x127x1 wz8jey /secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa [action.admin.user.UserBrowser] Exception getting users: java.lang.RuntimeException: Found more than one user with name 'claire.rougier'; ids [GenericEntity:OSUser][id,10464][name,claire.rougier][passwordHash,x61Ey612Kl2gpFL56FT9weDnpSo4AV8j8+qx2AuTHdRyY036xxzTTrw10Wq3+4qQyB+XURPWx1ONxp3Y3pB37A==], [GenericEntity:OSUser][id,10463][name,claire.rougier][passwordHash,x61Ey612Kl2gpFL56FT9weDnpSo4AV8j8+qx2AuTHdRyY036xxzTTrw10Wq3+4qQyB+XURPWx1ONxp3Y3pB37A==]
java.lang.RuntimeException: Found more than one user with name 'claire.rougier'; ids [GenericEntity:OSUser][id,10464][name,claire.rougier][passwordHash,x61Ey612Kl2gpFL56FT9weDnpSo4AV8j8+qx2AuTHdRyY036xxzTTrw10Wq3+4qQyB+XURPWx1ONxp3Y3pB37A==], [GenericEntity:OSUser][id,10463][name,claire.rougier][passwordHash,x61Ey612Kl2gpFL56FT9weDnpSo4AV8j8+qx2AuTHdRyY036xxzTTrw10Wq3+4qQyB+XURPWx1ONxp3Y3pB37A==]
	at com.opensymphony.user.provider.ofbiz.OFBizAbstractProvider.findUser(OFBizAbstractProvider.java:179)
	at com.opensymphony.user.provider.ofbiz.OFBizCredentialsProvider.handles(OFBizCredentialsProvider.java:144)
	at com.opensymphony.user.UserManager.getProvider(UserManager.java:269)
	at com.opensymphony.user.UserManager$Accessor.getCredentialsProvider(UserManager.java:347)
	at com.opensymphony.user.Entity.getCredentialsProvider(Entity.java:59)
	at com.opensymphony.user.User.<init>(User.java:52)
	at com.opensymphony.user.UserManager$Type$1.create(UserManager.java:47)
	at com.opensymphony.user.UserManager$Type$1.create(UserManager.java:45)
	at com.opensymphony.user.UserManager.buildEntity(UserManager.java:295)
	at com.opensymphony.user.UserManager.getEntities(UserManager.java:248)
	at com.opensymphony.user.UserManager.getUsers(UserManager.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.core.user.UserUtils.getAllUsers(UserUtils.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.UserBrowserFilter.getUsersFilteredByGroup(UserBrowserFilter.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.UserBrowserFilter.getFilteredUsers(UserBrowserFilter.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.UserBrowser.getBrowsableItems(UserBrowser.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.UserBrowser.doExecute(UserBrowser.java:55)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:59)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:141)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:181)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:729)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:269)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:188)
	at com.atlassian.core.filters.HeaderSanitisingFilter.doFilter(HeaderSanitisingFilter.java:44)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:215)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:188)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:46)
{code}

h4. Workaround
# Run the following SQL query:
{code}
select * from userbase where username = 'claire.rougier';
{code}
(i) Replace *claire.rougier* with the problematic username.
# You may get the following output:
{code}
+-------+----------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ID    | username       | PASSWORD_HASH                                                                            |
+-------+----------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 10464 | claire.rougier | xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx |
| 10463 | claire.rougier | xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx |
+-------+----------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
{code}
# Delete the latest ID that is mapped to the username:
{code}
delete from userbase where ID=10464;
{code}
# Restart the instance.
fields.summary: Ability to Create Duplicate User via SOAP Client-API

fields.description:
Cross-Site Request Forgery Security auditing tests performed on a *Jira Bug Issue and Project Tracking Software* locally running instance shown that the application is succeptible to Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks within this URL: [/jira/plugins/servlet/streamscomments] This vulnerability enables for an attacker to post comments inside an issue through a session created by a valid user logged into the system. Comments are signed by the logged user and can be posted without it's consent. The first image outlined below describes where the attack has been performed, the second image describes an example of the code used to trigger the Cross-Site Request Forgery and the third image describes the result of the attack: !fontCode.png! !pontoCsrfJira.png! !xx_resultadoCSRF.png! Furthermore, an example of the complete source-code of the Cross-Site Request Forgery html file can be found below: {noformat} ..:: TEMPEST XSRF ::..
.:: TEMPEST ::.

{noformat}
fields.summary: Cross-Site Request Forgery

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24714].
  {panel}

Please, refer the attached screenshot:
!Screenshot-4.png!

In the footer of all Jira pages there's an option: "Contact Administrators". When click on that, it's expected get a list of all administrators of the system, but this list only will be populated in case of the option *jira.paths.set.allowed* be allowed inside {{$JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties}}.

From version 4.1.1 Jira comes with this option disabled due to the following security vulnerability: [XSS and Privilege Escalation Vulnerabilities in JIRA|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-21004] which is acceptable so far. However, the link keeps appearing on the page even though does not working.

*The chief concern is: If this option wont work, it also should  not appear on the page footer.*
fields.summary: "Contact Administrators" footer link should not appear if "jira.paths.set.allowed" is set false

The links are there but the download is not working.
fields.summary: Source download for 4.3.4 not available

fields.description:
In Google Chrome, when clicking past the last character of a line, the caret is incorrectly placed at the start of the line.

This is very annoying as the only ways to move the caret at the end of a line is by precision clicking *not more than one pixel after the last character*, by moving the caret with the arrow keys or using the END key.

Please note that this works as expected in Firefox 4.0 and possibly other versions as well. I have not tested IE.
fields.summary: [Multi-line Text Editor] When clicking past the end of a line, the cursor is incorrectly placed at the start of the line

fields.description:
Beside the issue, can you change the reporter of the issue to btosabre, which is also our account?
By mistake the account has been duplicated in your system.

Please find below detailed explanation on new feature that we would like to add into JIRA:

Use case:
1. User gets into Component page, ex. https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP/component/10625

    Background: He might be only interested in 1 component out of many in the project, therefore he bookmarks this page.

2. User click on the Quick Create buttons, ex. Problem Report

3a. Current: System open create issue page.
3b: New feature: System open the create issue page with already preselected Component.

It is small change with nice-to-have priority.
fields.summary: Once the use get to Component page he would like to open the issues with already pre-selected component.

fields.description:
We have several projects with same kind of versions/components & users.
It will be very useful if one of project can be converted as a template to create other projects.
fields.summary: Request for supporting Project templates
Version custom field type does not validate parameters passed to it, though it looks like it wanted to

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to enforce unique field values for a custom field. 
The goal would be to make sure the custom field, e.g. Serial Number, is not emtered for more than 1 issue.
An attempt to create a duplicate entry should fail with an error. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Enforce unique value in custom field

fields.description: Good example, the Component 'UI / Usability' I chose for this very issue, I had to type it out as in IE9 it wont let me choose any of the options in the drop down menu - the menu appears fine, just I cant choose anything.
fields.summary: Can not choose from drop down lists in IE9

fields.description:
Hello,

There's a bug on JIRA 4.3.3 regarding FishEye/Crucible Application Links.

*Premise:*
You already have an application link to FishEye/Crucible on {{JIRA Administration >> Application Links}}, and it is marked as primary. Let's call it {{FeCruAppLink1}}.

*How to reproduce:*
# Go to {{JIRA Administration >> Application Links}}.
# Create another FishEye/Crucible application link (I'll call it {{FeCruAppLink2}}), and mark it as primary.
# A link {{"FishEye Configuration"}} will be displayed next to it. Click on it.
# You'll see the FishEye URL field being displayed as a text field, and the URL of the {{FeCruAppLink2}} application link is displayed.
# Click on the {{Update}} button.
# The page will be reloaded, however, *the URL of the {{FeCruAppLink1}} application link is displayed*.
# This shows that the {{FeCruAppLink2}} wasn't really marked as primary.

Please let me know if you need further explanation.
fields.summary: JIRA 4.3.3 and multiple FishEye/Crucible instances integration problem

fields.description:
i guess the tite says it:
- we have subversion not properly config'ed, that is: i get a lot of auth errors in the log.
ATM this bother us not much, hence we dont take care of it, having very little time...

anyhow, i had the subversion tab selected and then wanted to resolve the bug thru the operations popup and then i got a 500 from the server in that popup.
also hitting the button "resolve" had the same effect, only when going thru the "more actions" it worked (or so i think). 
going to the comment tab was fine and all worked.

so what i dont know is if it works when auth works or not.

fields.description:
The following feature would be a very valuable addition:
Allow select the columns when making a query. For example:
SELECT Update, Status, Summary, "Lessons Learned" WHERE project = PRI and "Lessons Learned" is not EMPTY
This would allow to save pre-defined filters with an specific selection of columns for each one.
fields.summary: Allow SELECT fields in the filter queries

fields.description:
There is a serious bug in JIRA 4.3-4.3.3 preventing JIRA from producing debugging output. We need to warn the customers about a need of the upgrade to 4.3.4 or applying the updated version of the library from 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24644

Customer reported this problem with IE9 (9.0.8112.16421)

with JIRA 4.3.2 & 4.3.4. The problems is not observed in the compatibility mode and FF

We couldn't reproduce this behaviour in JAC with IE9 (9.0.8112.16421) and JIRA 4.3.4

fields.summary: Main menu dropdowns don't display on hover over  in IE9

fields.description: I would like a field type added to the Custom Fields that allows me to create a multiple select field that is populated with a list of users from a specified Group of users. Currently, the workaround is to have a Multiple Select field where we have to manually add/remove each user to the list. This in turn requires JIRA to be reindexed. It would make more sense to have the a new field type that allows us to configure a Group of users without having to reindex the application.
fields.summary: A custom field type multiselect containing a selectable pre-defined set of users

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a filter named FooBar; don't share it with anyone
# Create a dashboard named MyDash and add a "Filter Results" gadget which points at this filter
# Share the dashboard with "Everyone"
# Have someone else go to Manage Dashboards -> Popular and open the MyDash dashboard

This gives a very confusing error message which suggests that something is actually broken under the hood.

One simple solution would be to change the error message so that it says "Sorry, you don't have access to the FooBar filter."

It would be even better if, in addition to a clearer error message, JIRA warned you when you shared the dashboard that it contained filters with different permissions, which might mess up the dashboard for people.

Or perhaps filters could be shared with "jira-users" by default.  This happened to me because I didn't even register that Filters are something you *can* "Share"; I just assumed a filter is a JQL query and that's all there is to say on the matter.
fields.summary: Sharing dashboards with unshared filters yields confusing results
JIRA http dump logs are inconsistent

fields.description:
Similar to JRA-24683

When transitioning an issue, it is often necessary to refer back to information or comments that or on the view issue screen, but not in the transition screen. If transition screens appeared as an expandable section, similar to the way comments currently work, it would make life much easier!
fields.summary: Transition screens should not use modal dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24687].
{panel}
In JIRA version 4.2.4 there is an "Assign To Me" button in the issue details screen which allows the user to change the issue's assignee value without going through one of the user defined workflow steps. This defeats the purpose of having configurable workflows steps since the user is able to change the state of the issue outside of the workflow. There should be a way to configure JIRA so that this button can be hidden or disabled.

An admin should also have the ability to hide the Assign menu button on the top of a ticket for the same purposes as listed above. If a user wants to only have the assignee determined by a workflow, this hinders that ability.

*Workaround:*
 For JIRA Server: Go to Admin, Plugins, System Plugins, Issue Operations Plugin, Manage plugin modules. Find the module named "View Issue Ops Bar Assign To Me Link (assign-to-me)" and click on the Disable button. The "Assign To Me" button will now not be displayed when viewing any issue.

(!) This is not available on JIRA Cloud because System Plugins are restricted.

+Another workaround using CSS:+
 * [How to hide the "Assign" and "Assign to me" links via CSS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-hide-the-assign-and-assign-to-me-links-via-css-665421833.html]
fields.summary: Provide ability to hide or disable Assign To Me button

fields.description:
All changes should be consistently reported online and in emails either as a understandable sentence or using an arrow to indicate what has been changed. Examples:
- "Assignee changed from Doe, John to unassigned."
- "Fix version changed from none to EXX123."
- "Sub-type: bug --> Enhancement"
- "Severity: none --> high"
fields.summary: Enhance layout / usability of standard JIRA email notifications

fields.description:
If you have enabled wiki rendering for JIRA fields you have the "preview" icon available in edit mode - which is good (see attachment).

Sometimes if you are in view mode, you see strange/unwanted wiki rendering for e.g. comments someone else entered. sometimes you cannot even understand the content. it would be good to have a "view wiki markup" icon for those cases.
fields.summary: Add "view wiki markup" icon to JIRA fields in view mode
In Gadget, Loading Class is not removed when Gadget content is built with AJAX calls

fields.description:
When you want to assign an issue to another user, you use the assign operation. You normally also add some comment during assign to give the user information why he is assigned and what the user should contribute to the issue. (That's why there is a comment box in the assign dialog.)

Typically while writing the comment for the assignment I need to browse through previous comments or the decription and do some copy and paste. 

For the standard comment dialog this works fine, but for the assign dialog this is not possible, because it is a modal dialog. With the modal dialog scrolling resp. copy and paste is not possible.

Therefore I recommend to change the dialog from modal dialog to something similar to comment dialog. I have attached a mockup of what I think it would be a useful solution.
fields.summary: Assign issue should not use modal dialog
Username With Space Trailing Should Be Trim During The Upgrade
REST API: allow admin user to operate as a different user

fields.description:
# Open the issue navigator and display some issues
# Open it in another tab *with a different set of issues*
# Go back to the first tab and select Tools -> Bulk Change -> All Issues

The subsequent bulk operation screen is populated with the issues displayed in the *second* tab.  This is very confusing, breaks my conceptual model of how the issue navigator is "supposed" to work, and could result in bulk actions being taken on the wrong issues.
fields.summary: Loading issue navigator in a separate tab causes bulk operation to populate with the wrong issues

fields.description: It would be great if we could keep history of the deleted or added comments.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to version comments.

fields.description:
I see this issue has history, for example JRA-861, JRA-33 and several other items.

I can now define a regex for project keys in jira-application.properties.

I would like to use a pattern like this:

{code:title=atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties}
jira.projectkey.pattern = ([a-z][0-9a-z]{1,6}\.[A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z]{1,4})
{code}

* We need to support multiple customers each with multiple projects in a number of JIRA installations.
* We need to be able to migrate JIRA projects between JIRA instances.

We need a namespace where the project keys of different customers won't collide regardless of whether they are using the same or different installations of JIRA.

The easiest way for us to do this would be to prefix our customer account name (from 2 to 7 lower case letters) to the Project Key, separated by a dot. Hence the above pattern.

JIRA accepts the pattern, but the JIRA user interface automatically converts project keys to uppercase. So, it's useless to specify any other pattern, because it won't work with the JIRA user interface anyway.

You need to fix this by doing one of the following:

* Allow lower case letters in Project Keys and also have the User Interface support this. The UI needs to check the project key against what is configured in jira.projectkey.pattern.  Now your UI uses some local logic, which is a bug. Of course it should be compatible with what the user has configured.

* If you don't want to support lower case letters, then document that in jira-application.properties.
fields.summary: Project Key format is configurable but lower case still not supported

fields.description:
Putting internal group into external groups, or vice versa or putting external group into external group, all does not work, even when authenticating with LDAP by the LDAP root user and using read/write permissions in the LDAP directory configuration. It always ends up with the error:
{code}
You do not have permission to perform this operation.
{code}

Suggestion:
If this feature is only meant to work for internal directories groups, we should:
* Have clearer error message on the problem (as it is not a permission issue here)
* Make it clear in our documentation that this feature is only for internal directories groups
* In the list of groups in the nested groups configuration page, there is no purpose (and it is rather misleading) to include non-internal directories groups when they will never work.

!nested groups problem.PNG!

Regards,
Ali
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Nested groups do not work between internal and external groups or between external and external groups

# Go to "Admin > Navigator Columns".
# Remove all the columns.
# (DEFECT) Run a new search request that finds some issues. You will get this:

!no_columns.png!

If you see some data the current user might have custom columns configured for their user. You will need to remove this user's custom columns to see this bug. 

*Also*, The actual HTML page returned from JIRA is invalid. For example, there are "tr" elements in the page without any table. Check out [^page.html].

fields.description:
I am connected to an Active Directory that has ~30,000 users and ~2,600 groups.

When I go to *Administration* > *User Browser*, click on a user, then click *Groups* under *Operations*, I get to the *EditUserGroups* page.

It is painful to find a group in the left *select* field. Not only does it shows all 2,600+ groups, there's no vertical scroll bar within the field. I have to scroll down using the browser's scroll bar, find and click on the group, and then scroll all the way back to the top and click the *Join>>* button.

Furthermore, the groups are improperly sorted--upper case *Z* gets sorted before lower case *a*. That is as absurd as a dictionary putting every (capitalized) proper nouns before the first (uncapitalized) common noun.

It would be nice if you could have an autoselect-type field that starts matching group names as I type them.
fields.summary: EditUserGroups very difficult to use with many groups

fields.description:
In the schema for atalassian-plugin.xml, located at http://schema.atlassian.com/jira/jira-4.3.xsd the type of the "resource" element under version-tabpanel is "string" instead of "resourceType"

Every other resource element in the schema is of type "resourceType", and documentation in the tabpanel element indicates that this one should be, too.  (As does the module documentation here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Version+Tab+Panel+Plugin+Module)
fields.summary: Incorrect type for element "resource" under element "version-tabpanel" in jira-4.3.xsd

The Download Center gives a link for JIRA 4.3.3 Standalone TAR.GZ Archive, atlassian-jira-4.3.3.tar.gz, which I downloaded.  The installation guide says to cd to the '.bin' file's directory.  There is no .bin file in in the tar.gz archive.

Please update the installation instructions to correlate with what is available for download.

This may seem like a nit, but my time is in short supply so this is yet another thing I would have to schedule in.

fields.description:
When you have an issue number, like JIRA-12345, it doesn't work to use the underscore to italicize the text:

This:

{code}
_After JRA-11564_ was solved... something happened.
{code}

Becomes this:

_After JRA-11564_ was solved... something happened.

This is true for all inline markup: italics (underscores), bold (asterisks), underline (pluses), strikethrough (dashes).

----

This is a workaround:
{code}
_After_ _JRA-11564_ was solved... something happened.
{code}

which becomes:

_After_ _JRA-11564_ was solved... something happened.
fields.summary: Italics/bold etc doesn't work when an issue specification (like JRA-12345) is between the underscores

fields.description:
At the moment, to search for *UNRESOLVED* issues' resolution need to be defined explicitly e.g. {{Project = "ABC" AND resolution != Fixed or resolution = UNRESOLVED}}

If the *UNRESOLVED* is not defined in the JQL, JIRA won't searched for issues with that resolution. This could be a critical issue for users who didn't realize about this.
fields.summary: Problem in JQL logic for searching issues' resolutions

fields.description:
The Assignee system field is populated with the *Full Name* of users who have assignable users permissions with first user on the list corresponding to the reporter of the issue. In a scenario where the full name of users is prefixed or suffixed with dashes "-", then the list is no longer sorted alphabetical but Random.

See screen shot for the behavior. I believe the list should be something like:

{noformat}
Sultan1
Sultan2
Sultan4
Sultan5
- Sultan 3 -
- Sultan 13 -
- Sultan 33 -
{noformat}
fields.summary: Assignee list not sorted alphabetically when full name contains dashes "-"

fields.description:
Since we now support better LDAP integration it is more likely that customers will connect to an ldap directory with 1000s of groups.  The problem is that we have several pages in JIRA that display a grouppicker as a select box.  Most browsers nearly grind to a halt when rendering a select box with 50000+ entries.  Also the UI control is completely useless for selecting a group.

We should replace grouppickers with single select autocomplete controls similar to how our new user picker works.

fields.description:
I ran into this problem while upgrading from 4.2.1-b588 to 4.3.3.  The problem occurs both when using the Export/Import upgrade method as well as the in-place direct database upgrade paths.  

The problem occurs under the following circumstances.  
- Crowd Integration is enabled on a user directory with more than 10,000 users
- two internal Jira users are present in the Jira database from pre-crowd integration (though these are not used at all in any projects, issues, or permissions)
- The exported XML version of the database contains membership information like: <OSMembership id="10000" userName="<username>" groupName="jira-administrators"/>
- the crowd directory does NOT include groups that match the default Jira groups: jira-administrators, jira-developers, jira-users

The exception contained in the attached text file occurs during the upgrade, and blocks the upgrade as well as rendering Jira unusable.  

My only solution to the problem was to revert the database to a pre-upgrade backup and then manually remove the users/groups and memberships records from the three tables userbase, groupbase and membershipbase.  

More information can be found on this problem in your support system under the issue JSP-80318
fields.summary: Crowd membership information import can fail when internal Jira users are still present in the database (or import XML file)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24630].
  {panel}

As of now, View -> Excel (All Fields) doesn't export any of the details of the Activity Section of a JIRA.

We are specifically interested in the Source Tab of the Activity Section, as Source tab lists the changeset
details (files checked in corresponding to a JIRA fix).
Kindly add an option in JIRA so that Activity section details of a JIRA can be searched, extracted/exported.
JQL also doesn't list Activity in it's Fields Reference.
This feature is highly desired, as it would let us get the complete export of information associated with a JIRA.
Request you to let us know when can this be made available in JIRA

(Outlook mail thread of Support request raised for this issue is attached)
fields.summary: Activity Section details export option required in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24628].
  {panel}

Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this problem:
*Using JIRA 4.3.x*:
# Log in to JIRA
# Create a sample issue in Testing project (e.g:TST-1 - http://localhost:8071/browse/TST-1)
# Go to _Administration -> Global Settings -> Trackbacks_ and make sure that 'Accept Incoming Trackback Pings' is being set to *ON*
# Startup *Confluence 3.5.x* server
# Create a sample page in a testing space
# Navigate to _Browse -> Confluence Admin -> Configuration -> General Configuration_ 
# Check on 'Trackback' option
# Use this link - http://10.60.1.173:8071/browse/TST-1 and paste it to the Confluence page that just being created
# Go back to JIRA page and click on Refresh
|

*No trackback ping is shown at all*. Bidirectional Application Links using Trusted Apps have already being set up on both JIRA and Confluence and yet, not working. *This problem does not happen using any Confluence version of 3.4.x and below with JIRA 4.2.x and below*. See this screenshot:
!Trackback_Works.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Trackback Links does not work in JIRA 4.3.x with Confluence 3.5.x

fields.description:

Now, we're using TimeSheet plugin, which is really good, but any problem with it will be NOT supported by Jira, because it's a thrid party plugin.

We, at University of Murcia, think this is an important issue.

Thank's in advance.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24624].
  {panel}

WebworkService - actionMapper  com.atlassian.seraph.util.CachedPathMapper is 7MB in size

Its seems to have included every URL every seen.  Is this delibreate?

eg key  java.lang.String "/32680_bullet_creme.gif", key  java.lang.String "/JRA-3476", key  java.lang.String "/ConfluenceActionSupport_de_DE.properties"


We should use a LRU map in some way to limit how big this gets

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+4.3+Heap+Dump+Staring

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start with a project with multiple issue types.
2. Have a customfield that is restricted to only some of the issue types of the project
3. Configure your Issue Navigator to show the customfields column.
4. Do a search for the whole project.

Expected Result:
The customfield value is visiable in the customfields column for those issues that has a value.

Actual Result:
Customfiel column is not visiable.

Workaround:
Modify the issue search to only search for the specific issue types that contains the customfield.

Best Regards
Rickard Johansson (Tieto)
fields.summary: Issue Columns not Displaying After Column Configuration

fields.description:
Heyas,

i am sure this has been asked before, but i couldn't find anything about it: Is it possible to create a filter based on the project table (not on the issue table)? We have around 75+ projects running in our JIRA instance and it would be cool to have filters on the various projects (like "current user is administrator" or "current user is in developer list").
It would really enhance the product for us. I have looked at a plugin already, but didnt find any...

thanks and regards
Marc

(PS: see also: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-80060)
fields.summary: Feature Request: Make filters available on projects
